page.title: 13Places of Work
page.content: When we looked at the way our parents earned their living we found out that all the fathers worked and that two-thirds of the mothers worked. The occupations of fathers were very different. {Work place}Most fathers leave earlier in the morning, come home later and more work away from Ticehurst. Just over half the working mothers worked less than a full day. A quarter of the fathers work within or very close to the block while nearly another quarter work in London. The rest work within a radius of twenty miles of Ticehurst at places like Tunbridge Wells, Lamberhurst, Wadhurst and Hastings. Most mothers work in the Ticehurst area. {Transport}One father travels by train, the remainder by motor vehicles, mainly cars as do most of the mothers.
